result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frederick Ortiz

records.addlTxt: The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. Waukesha Police Department advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 11-21-2022.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Calendar Call. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense counsel advises the court he has been unsuccessful in contacting client. 
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to Commissioner, and no action on bail.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Status Conference. 
DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense counsel request a calendar call date. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be in person.  Calendar call scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Frederick Ortiz in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Frederick Ortiz appeared by video means with Attorney.  HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.   
Case in court for status conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer.  Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.  Case adjourned to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.   
Defense counsel recently appointed and awaiting discovery and offer in this case.
 Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Frederick Ortiz in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Frederick Ortiz in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Frederick Ortiz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
 This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79 Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
